lead_paragraph: Iraqi forces liberating the city are finding beheaded bodies, apocalyptic streetscapes and clumps of hair from fighters who shaved to blend in with fleeing civilians. Our reporter describes what he saw.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Clearing Falluja and Revealing Grim Reminders of ISIS’ Rule
headline.main: A Tour of Falluja Reveals Grim Remnants of Life Under ISIS

snippet: Iraqi forces liberating the city are finding beheaded bodies, apocalyptic streetscapes and clumps of hair from fighters who shaved to blend in with fleeing civilians. Our reporter describes what he saw.
abstract: Falluja is still site of heavy fighting between Iraqi government forces and remaining Islamic State fighters; third of city has been cleared by fighters, and cleared areas are revealing grim signs of what life under Islamic State was like.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
